spurge family.gloss: a family of plants of order Geraniales

spurious wing.gloss: tuft of small stiff feathers on the first digit of a bird's wing

spurring.gloss: a verbalization that encourages you to attempt something

spurt.gloss: gush forth in a sudden stream or jet
move or act with a sudden increase in speed or energy

utter with a spitting sound, as if in a rage
spit up in an explosive manner

sputtering.gloss: the noise of something spattering or sputtering explosively

sputum smear.gloss: any of several cytologic smears obtained from different parts of the lower respiratory tract

spyhole.gloss: a hole (in a door or an oven etc) through which you can peep

spying.gloss: the act of keeping a secret watch for intelligence purposes

spark off.gloss: put in motion or move to act

speak out.gloss: express one's opinion openly and without fear or hesitation

speak up.gloss: express one's opinion openly and without fear or hesitation

specialise.gloss: devote oneself to a special area of work
become more focused on an area of activity or field of study
evolve so as to lead to a new species or develop in a way most suited to the environment

evolve so as to lead to a new species or develop in a way most suited to the environment

speciate.gloss: evolve so as to lead to a new species or develop in a way most suited to the environment

speculate.gloss: to believe especially on uncertain or tentative grounds

spell out.gloss: orally recite the letters of or give the spelling of

spellbind.gloss: to render motionless, as with a fixed stare or by arousing terror or awe

spend.gloss: use up a period of time in a specific way

spew.gloss: expel or eject (saliva or phlegm or sputum) from the mouth

spike out.gloss: bring forth a spike or spikes

synonyms.word: let the cat out of the bag

spin around.gloss: revolve quickly and repeatedly around one's own axis

spit out.gloss: spit up in an explosive manner
discharge (phlegm or sputum) from the lungs and out of the mouth

spit up.gloss: discharge (phlegm or sputum) from the lungs and out of the mouth

sponge down.gloss: clean with a sponge, by rubbing

spout.gloss: gush forth in a sudden stream or jet
talk in a noisy, excited, or declamatory manner

sprain.gloss: twist suddenly so as to sprain

spume.gloss: make froth or foam and become bubbly

spastic.gloss: affected by involuntary jerky muscular contractions

spatial.gloss: pertaining to or involving or having the nature of space

spatiotemporal.gloss: existing in both space and time

spattered.gloss: covered with bright patches (often used in combination)
